page.title: 17LEISURE IN PRESTON
page.content: We wanted to find out what a class of 29 children aged 11 and their parents did in their spare time. Sporting activities were by far the most popular children's pastime with football(62%) and swimming(69%) the clear leaders. 41% of the children asked, watched television. A similar proportion of parents said that watching television was one of their hobbies. There was evidence that some children enjoyed sharing parents hobbies(or vice-versa!). For example six households listed either snooker or fishing as a pastime for both child and parent. Another popular spare time activity of both child and adults was reading - 31% of children and 47% of adults included this.
